text.section: Except as otherwise provided in this title, an individual shall be licensed by the Board before the individual may practice architecture in the State.

section.section:
An architect who resides outside the State and meets the requirements for a license by reciprocity under § 3-306 of this subtitle may:
offer to practice architecture in the State; and
accept a commission to practice architecture in the State.
Notwithstanding paragraph (1) of this subsection, the architect shall be licensed by the Board before the architect may practice architecture in the State.
